info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 7:47PM EDT until July 20 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Floyd, Magoffin and Wolfe.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and may eventually lead to flash flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prestonsburg, Jackson, Simpson, Martin, Camp Lewis, Guage, Foraker, Lambric, Lunah, Cornelia, Rousseau, Daisydell, Tiptop, Bays, Carver Station, Carver, Sikes, Stevenson, Mountain Valley and Duco.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Breathitt, KY; Floyd, KY; Magoffin, KY; Wolfe, KY
